title: Britain's Got Talent finalist Leeroy Bailey to stand trial accused of child neglect
text:
Comments A BRITAIN’S Got Talent finalist will appear in court today to face child neglect charges. 
Leeroy Bailey, 36, was a member of dance troupe Kombat Breakers who lost out to opera singer Paul Potts in the 2007 final. 
It is alleged that the dance teacher neglected a child “in a manner likely to cause suffering or injury to health” in February last year. 
The 36-year-old originally denied the charge at Coventry Magistrates Court in May 2016 and elected to have the case heard by a jury at crown court. 
Bailey is on bail with the condition that he is supervised if he comes into contact with anyone under the age of 18. 
This includes any dance classes that Bailey – who has worked as a dance teacher, actor and model – may teach. 
The trial is due to take place at Warwick Crown Court. The trial comes after a thug admitted shoving another BGT star to the ground after taking a selfie with him. 
Comic Jack Carroll, who suffers from cerebral palsy, ended up prostrated on the floor with his walking frame on top of him after the assault. 
His attacker Elliot O’Kane, 19, pleaded guilty to assault at Kirklees Magistrates Court earlier this month.
